content.description: You will be asked you to identify rhythms. After a question is announced, you will have ten seconds to read the choices. It is important that you read the choices carefully before the example is played. Each example will be played twice, with a brief pause between playings.
content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: Score A has one staff in the treble clef. There are no key signatures. It has a time signature of six eight time. Score A has two measures with a pickup measure of an eighth note G4. The rhythm in measure 1 of score A is: quarter, eighth, eighth, sixteenth, sixteenth, and eighth. The pitches are: C5, B4, C5, B4, A4, and G4. The rhythm in measure 2 of score A is: sixteenth, sixteenth, dotted eighth, sixteenth, and quarter. The pitches are D5, C5, D5, B4, and C5.

Score B has one staff in the treble clef. There are no key signatures. It has a time signature of six eight time. Score B has two measures with a pickup measure having an eighth note G4. The rhythm in measure 1 of score B is: quarter, eighth, sixteenth, sixteenth, eighth, and eighth. The pitches are: C5, B4, C5, B4, A4, and G4. The rhythm in measure 2 of score B is: eighth, eighth, sixteenth, sixteenth, and quarter. The pitches are D5, C5, D5, B4, and C5. Score C consists of two measures.

Score C has one staff in the treble clef. There are no key signatures. It has a time signature of six eight time. The rhythm in measure 1 of score C is: eighth, quarter, sixteenth, sixteenth, sixteenth, sixteenth, and eighth. The pitches are: G4, C5, B4, C5, B4, A4, and G4. The rhythm in measure 2 of score C is: sixteenth, sixteenth, quarter, eighth, and quarter. The pitches are D5, C5, D5, B4, and C5. Score D consists of two measures.

Score D has one staff in the treble clef. There are no key signatures. It has a time signature of six eight time. The rhythm in measure 1 of score D is: eighth, quarter, eighth, sixteenth, sixteenth, sixteenth, and sixteenth. The pitches are: G4, C5, B4, C5, B4, A4, and G4. The rhythm in measure 2 of score D is: eighth, eighth, sixteenth, sixteenth, quarter, and eighth rest. The pitches are D5, C5, D5, B4, and C5.

content.answer: Score D has one staff in the treble clef. There are no key signatures. It has a time signature of six eight time. The rhythm in measure 1 of score D is: eighth, quarter, eighth, sixteenth, sixteenth, sixteenth, and sixteenth. The pitches are: G4, C5, B4, C5, B4, A4, and G4. unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Use symbols and terms to describe features of rhythm in performed music, including meter, note values, and rhythmic patterns and devices.
